title: Understanding Dissociative Fugue
text: Dissociative fugue is a rare condition where a person suddenly travels away from home or work and cannot recall their past. It often involves confusion about personal identity or the adoption of a new identity.

title: Characteristics of Dissociative Fugue
text: Key features include unexpected travel, inability to recall one's past, and confusion about personal identity.

hintAnswer: unexpected or unplanned travel and amnesia regarding one’s identity, and $$\frac{depersonalization}{derealization}$$ disorder, marked by feelings of detachment from oneself or their surroundings
title: Identifying Symptoms
text: What are the symptoms of dissociative fugue?
choices: unexpected or unplanned travel and amnesia regarding one’s identity, and $$\frac{depersonalization}{derealization}$$ disorder, marked by feelings of detachment from oneself or their surroundings
Dissociative Experiences Scale (DES) or the Structured Clinical Interview for Dissociative Disorders $$(SCID-D)$$
an alteration in the perception or experience of oneself, where an individual may feel detached or estranged from their thoughts, feelings, body, or actions
process of synthesizing different aspects of a person’s identity, experience, and functioning into a cohesive and harmonious whole
